# Intro_to_Fintech_Homework_1

## Case Study for Plaid
![](data:image/png;base64,)
* Plaid
* Plaid was incorporated in 2013.
* The founders are Zach Perret and William Hockey.
* The founders of Plaid set out to create consumer financial management producets. Their vision included software to help budgeting, bookpeeting, and personal accounting. However, in the process of trying to create their product they realize their was a gap in existing technology. There was no simple way to create a financial product that could connect to all the banking accounts. It was this point that they shifted their focus to making an unified banking API that make this possible.
* From 2013 to 2018 the company raised over 300 million USD. The initial investment of 2.8 million came from Spark Capital. Other companies, such as Google Ventures and Goldman Sachs would follow later. Since then Plaid was purchased by Visa for over 5 billion USD.

## Business Activities
* Simply stated, Plaid has built a platform that enables applications to connect with user bank accounts.
*  Plaid's target customer is any company that aims to make applications that need assess to banking/account data.
* Plaid uses over 50 products as reported in a thread on Quora which claims to be verified by vendors and employees. Plaid uses products such as Cloudfront, Redis, Rollbar, Gusto, and fintech products such as eShares. Plaid is built with a number of these products and uses others to mantain their operations. One of the most notable technogolies Plaid uses is screen scraping.

##Landscape
* Plaid could be considered to be apart of the Personal Finance/Deposits/Online Banking industry, given how Plaid is used to enable of these technologies for consumers.
* Over the last 10 years, one of the biggest questions in online banking was when would Big Tech pivot towards getting involed in finanace. Creating products that make it easier for consumers to manage their personal life convinently is the name of the game. Plaid literally stands to be in the center of it all by being the bridge between these new products and the accounts these consumers need access to. 
* Plaid bought one of their competitors, Quovo, for 200 million USD in January of 2019.

##Results
* Plaid's impact has been massive thus far.Plaid is the technology behind the world's largest money transfering apps, like Venmo and investment apps like Betterment. 
* The measure of success for most businesses at this stage is revenue. When compared to other rivals such Xignite and Finicity, Plaid is during very well, posting revenues 70% higher their competition.

##Recommendations
* Plaid has already announced a transition from screen scraping to token based transactions to secure customer and bank data. I recommend Plaid look into decentralizing their transactions with blockchain to provide better security.
